comment: Lemma for ~ sylow3 , second part. Using the lemma ~ sylow2a , show that the number of sylow subgroups is equivalent ` mod P ` to the number of fixed points under the group action. But ` K ` is the unique element of the set of Sylow subgroups that is fixed under the group action, so there is exactly one fixed point and so ` ( ( # `` ( P pSyl G ) ) mod P ) = 1 ` . (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 19-Jan-2015.)
